metadata.title: CVE-2022-25636 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
net/netfilter/nf_dup_netdev.c in the Linux kernel 5.4 through 5.6.10 allowslocal users to gain privileges because of a heap out-of-bounds write. Thisis related to nf_tables_offload.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-104-generic - 5.4.0-104.118~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-104-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-104.118~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-104.118~18.04.1').
